steps.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together 2 cups of flour, 1 cup of sugar, and 2 teaspoons of baking powder.
In a separate bowl, whisk together 1/2 cup of freshly squeezed lemon juice, 1/4 cup of vegetable oil, and 2 large eggs.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Don't overmix!
Pour the batter into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and let cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Then, transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Enjoy your delicious lemon cake!
Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together 2 cups of flour, 1 cup of sugar, and 2 teaspoons of baking powder.
In a separate bowl, whisk together 1/2 cup of unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/4 cup of vegetable oil, and 2 large eggs.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Don't overmix!
Pour the batter into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and let cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Then, transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Enjoy your delicious chocolate cake!
Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together 2 cups of flour, 1 cup of sugar, and 2 teaspoons of baking powder.
In a separate bowl, whisk together 1/2 cup of grated carrots, 1/4 cup of chopped walnuts, and 2 large eggs.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Don't overmix!
Pour the batter into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and let cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Then, transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Enjoy your delicious carrot cake!
